00004 #define OSPF_AGING_INTERVAL             4
00005 #define OSPF_AGING_INCREMENT            4
00006 #define OSPF_AGING_FACTOR               (OSPF_AGING_INCREMENT / OSPF_AGING_INTERVAL)

00008 #define OSPF_RETRANS_INTERVAL           5

00010 /* nbr interface state machine states */

00013 {

00020         ospf_int_point_to_point_st
00021 };

00071 /*
00072  * ospf_nbr:
00073  * 
00074  * the neighbor data structure described in the OSPF RFC
00075  */
00076 DEF(struct, ospf_nbr)
00077 {
00078         rn_machine              *m;
00079         rn_area                 *ar;
00080 
00081         /*
00082          * Neighbor variables
00083          */
00084         ospf_link_type           ltype;
00085         ospf_state              *router;
00086         ospf_nbr_state           state;
00087         ospf_int_state           istate; 
00088         
00089         tw_stime                 last_sent;
00090         
00091         /* These do not need to be so large! */
00092         tw_stime        hello_interval;
00093         tw_stime        router_dead_interval;
00094         tw_stime        bandwidth;
00095 
00096         unsigned char    master;
00097         unsigned int dd_seqnum;
00098 
00099         unsigned int    id;
00100 
00101         unsigned int    priority;
00102         unsigned int    designated_r;
00103         unsigned int    b_designated_r;
00104 
00105         /*
00106          * Neighbor timer variables
00107          *
00108          * hello_timer          -- timer to wake me up so I can send my nbr HELLOs
00109          * inactivity_timer     -- HELLO inactive timer, real tw_timer
00110          * flood_accum          -- the length of the LSAs in the flood pkt
00111          * next_flood           -- next flood time
00112          * flood                -- flood timer, next flood msg
00113          * retrans_accum        -- size of next retrans msg
00114          * next_retransmit      -- next retransmit time
00115          * retrans              -- retransmit timer, next retrans msg
00116          * delay_ack_timer      -- ACK timer, real tw_timer
00117          */
00118         tw_event        *hello_timer;
00119         tw_event        *inactivity_timer;
00120 
00121         unsigned int     flood_accum;
00122         tw_stime         next_flood;
00123         tw_event        *flood;
00124 
00125         unsigned int     retrans_accum;
00126         tw_stime         next_retransmit;
00127         tw_event        *retrans_timer;
00128 
00129         tw_event        *delay_ack_timer;
00130 
00131         /*
00132          * Neighbor messages
00133          *
00134          * last_recv_dd         -- the last DD pkt I recv'd, might need to
00135          *                         resend this pkt at some point, so keep
00136          *                         a pointer to it.
00137          * retrans_dd           -- the currently sent DD pkt, which may
00138          *                         need to be retransmitted, so keep a ptr
00139          *                         to this also.
00140          * next_db_entry        -- the next DB entry to send in the next
00141          *                         DD pkt sequence.
00142          * hello                -- HELLO message to neighbor
00143          */
00144         tw_memory       *last_recv_dd;
00145         tw_memory       *retrans_dd;
00146 
00147         unsigned int     next_db_entry;
00148 
00149         ospf_hello      *hello;
00150 
00151         /*
00152          * Neighbor lists
00153          *
00154          * nrequest     -- size of my request list
00155          * requests     -- array of all neighbors.  When an entry is set
00156          *                 to zero, no request needed, otherwise request it.
00157          */
00158         unsigned int     nrequests;
00159         char                    *requests;
00160 
00161         tw_memory       *delay;
00162         unsigned int     delay_ack_size;
00163 };
00164 
00165 #endif
